titles.title: Relating to a question of the privileges of the House.

action.text: Point of order raised by Mr. Walker on the content of the measure. Mr. Walker stated that the content of the resolution did constitute a point of privilege. Point of order overruled by the Chair.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 244 - 183, 1 Present (Roll no. 356).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/22/1993--Introduced. Provides that when the U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia informs the House of Representatives that he has no objection to the public release of the transcripts of proceedings of the former Task Force to Investigate the Operation and Management of the House Post Office of the Committee on House Administration, the House shall take up and bring to a vote the question of the release of such transcripts. Directs: (1) the Speaker to communicate to the U.S. Attorney the request of the House that he advise the House when he determines that he has no objection to the public release of the transcripts; and (2) the Clerk to transmit such communication of the Speaker and a copy of this resolution to the U.S. Attorney.
